greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 + x) * (1 + x^3) / (1 + x^4) in powers of x.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = 0^e, a(p^e) = 1 if p == 1 or 3 (mod 8), a(p^e) = (-1)^e otherwise and a(0) = 1.
a(n) = -a(-n) for all n in Z unless n = 0. a(n+4) = -a(n) unless n = 0 or n = -4. a(2*n) = 0 unless n = 0.
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ EvenQ[ n], Boole[n == 0], (-1)^Quotient[ n, 4]];
a[ n_] := If[ n == 0, 1, Sign[ n] SeriesCoefficient[ (1 + x) * (1 + x^3) / (1 + x^4), {x, 0, Abs @ n}]];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n==0, 1, sign(n) * polcoeff( (1 + x) * (1 + x^3) / (1 + x^4), + x* O(x^abs(n)), abs(n)))};
(MAGMA) m:=60; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!((1+x)*(1+x^3)/(1+x^4))); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 02 2018
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 17 2015
